intro: Meibomia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Meibomia grandiflora thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
